com.idibon.api.http

Class HttpFuture<Result extends javax.json.JsonValue>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idibon.api.http.HttpFuture<Result>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future<Either<IOException,Result>>

    public final class HttpFuture<Result extends javax.json.JsonValue>
extends Object
implements Future<Either<IOException,Result>>
    Wraps the result of a Future, either exceptional or succsesful in an Either monad, suppressing the thrown exception.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected HttpFuture(Future<Result> base)

      Either<IOException,Result> get()
      See Future.get()
      Either<IOException,Result> get(long timeout, TimeUnit unit)
      See Future.get(long, TimeUnit) If an exception was thrown by the asynchronous HTTP request represented by this Future, the exception will be caught and returned in an Either left instance, rather than thrown.
      <T extends Result>
      Either<IOException,T>      		 getAs(Class<T> clazz)
      Casts a successful result to a subclass of the standard Result type.

        public <T extends Result> Either<IOException,T> getAs(Class<T> clazz)
        Casts a successful result to a subclass of the standard Result type.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The expected type of a successful return value.
        Returns:
        Either with a left IOException and a right of type clazz

      • wrap

        public static <R extends javax.json.JsonValue> HttpFuture<R> wrap(Future<R> base)
        Converts a Future that returns a JsonValue or throws an Exception into an HttpFuture that returns an Either.
        Parameters:
        base - Underlying Future that will either throw an Exception or return a JSON result value
        Returns:
        An HttpFuture wrapping base with an Either return value.
